page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content:
{BURY MOUNT -}was probably constructed in the 12th Century as the centre of a Royal Estate. It is believed to have controlled the { {Medieval road}to Northampton. It was altered during the Civil War by{Prince {Rupert,}who fortified the town in {1643.}It's present form is the result of later landscaping.
{WATLING STREET:- THE OLD TOWN HALL: { *}An impressive building, built in 1865, in Italian style with turrets and a clock. { *}In the main hall beneath the floor, is a stone lined well.
{ *}Situated at the point of a triangular market square, it has been used as an{amenity centre, local {government offices}and at the moment is looked after by the{Parish Council.
